decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The applicant has not confirmed that the materials for the proposed single storey rear extension shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse and is therefore not within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1 Class A. 3 (a) of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended

Reason : 2 - The cubic content of the resulting roof space would exceed the cubic content of the original roof space by more than 40 cubic metres for a terraced dwelling house and is therefore not within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1 Class B.1 (d (i)) of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended

Reason : 3 - The applicant has not confirmed that the materials for the proposed roof extensions shall be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse and is therefore not within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1 Class B.2 (a) of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended

Reason : 4 - The applicant has not confirmed that the proposed rooflights would protrude more than 0.15 metres beyond the plane of the slope of the original roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the original roof and is therefore not within the tolerances of Schedule 2, Part 1 Class C.1 (b) of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended
Reason : 5 - The proposal is NOT therefore a lawful development
description:
CERTIFICATE OF LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT (PROPOSED):
Alterations and extension to roof to form end gable; rear dormer with Juliette balcony; two rooflights in front roofslope; single storey rear extension (part demolition of rear extension)
